page.title: 12LIGHT-A-PIPE FARM HUNDLETON
page.content: Light-a-pipe Farm has about 70 acres. Its crops are potatoes, corn, hay and silage. The animals on the farm are dairy cows and beef cattle, the breeds are Friesian and cross-Hereford. There are 3 workers, and they handle everything on the farm. The farmer's name is Ian Hay. In use are 4 tractors - 2 John Deare, 1 Ford and 1 International. Produce is usually taken every day to Haverfordwest. The farm has a cultivator, a plough and a potato harvester. There are 7 sheds of various kinds - a potato shed, a chitting shed (to 'sprout' new potatoes), a milking parlour, a cowshed, a store shed, a tractor shed and a hay shed. There are 125 to 130 cows altogether, but no dogs.
